intro: Brossaea bracteata var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaf brossaea, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its heart-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding to its ornamental value. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
